title: Defines "owner occupied" for the purposes of small claim real property assessment review
summary: Defines "owner occupied" for the purposes of small claim real property assessment review.

                                         2101

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 13, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. LAVINE -- read once and referred to the Committee
         on Real Property Taxation

       AN  ACT  to  amend the real property tax law, in relation to eligibility
         for small claims assessment review

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. Subdivision 9 of section 730 of the real property tax law,
    2  as added by chapter 363 of the laws of  2003,  is  amended  to  read  as
    3  follows:
    4    9.  (A) Where real property is held in trust solely for the benefit of
    5  a person or persons, such person or persons may  be  deemed  to  be  the
    6  owner or owners of such property for purposes of this title.
    7    (B) REAL PROPERTY SHALL BE DEEMED TO BE OWNER OCCUPIED FOR PURPOSES OF
    8  THIS TITLE WHENEVER:
    9    (I)  THE REAL PROPERTY IS OCCUPIED BY THE OWNER OF RECORD OR ANY OTHER
   10  PERSON WHO QUALIFIES AS AN OWNER PURSUANT  TO  THE  PROVISIONS  OF  THIS
   11  SUBDIVISION  EITHER  ON  THE  TAXABLE  STATUS  DATE, OR UPON THE DATE OF
   12  FILING OF A PETITION UNDER THIS TITLE,
   13    (II) EITHER THE TRUSTEE OF A TRUST OR THE PERSON OR PERSONS FOR  WHOSE
   14  BENEFIT THE TRUST HAS BEEN CREATED OCCUPIES THE REAL PROPERTY,
   15    (III)  THE  REAL  PROPERTY IS OWNED BY THE ESTATE OF A DECEASED PERSON
   16  WHO OCCUPIED THE REAL PROPERTY PRIOR TO HIS OR HER DEATH, AND WHILE PART
   17  OF SUCH ESTATE IS NOT INCOME PRODUCING, OR
   18    (IV) IS REAL PROPERTY OCCUPIED BY A  LIFE  TENANT  OF  A  LIFE  ESTATE
   19  CREATED BY DEED OR OTHERWISE.
   20    (C)  FOR  THE  PURPOSES  OF  DETERMINING OWNERSHIP OF REAL PROPERTY OR
   21  DETERMINING WHETHER THE PROPERTY IS OWNER OCCUPIED AS REQUIRED  BY  THIS
   22  TITLE,  A  COPY OF A DEED, TRUST INSTRUMENT, LETTERS OF PROBATE OR OTHER
   23  SIMILAR DOCUMENT ISSUED BY THE SURROGATE COURT, OR A  WRITTEN  AGREEMENT
   24  OR  CONTRACT  WHICH DETAILS AN OWNERSHIP INTEREST IN A ONE, TWO OR THREE
   25  FAMILY DWELLING WHERE THE OWNER CAN OFFER SUBSTANTIAL PROOF THAT  HE  OR

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07208-01-1

       A. 2101                             2

    1  SHE  FULLY INTENDS TO OCCUPY THE SAME UPON COMPLETION, SHALL BE PRESUMP-
    2  TIVE AS PROOF  THAT  THE  PERSON  ON  WHOSE  BEHALF  SUCH  DOCUMENT  WAS
    3  PRESENTED  WAS  THE  OWNER OR OWNER OCCUPANT, AS THE CASE MAY BE, OF THE
    4  REAL PROPERTY.
    5    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
